Reviews.Title: “Professional staff & very clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AdelTOUHAMI
Reviews.Content: Hats off for Q INN Hotel old city Sirkeci , Istanbul ! Having honeyooned in Sultanahmet 2 years ago , my mom was harping on me to take her to Istanbul but owing to my rotational job I could not . So , I got in touch with bunch of hotels close-by the Blue Mosque , topkapi...though much to my surprise most were fully booked or picked up their price tag to !90 or 100 euro/ night. Luckily, I was swiftly fedback by Director Cem DALCI at Q Inn hotel old city and after 4 emails we strole a good deal , reservation confirmation NÂ°= emailed to me without even wiring a deposit. On D-day & despite the red eye flight Algiers-Istanbul ,Q I H driver was on time to pick up mom & auntie at 01:30 am for free-fritty-free. The staff was very receptive to FAQ , guidance as to my major tourist spots & the way to get there. Overall, this hotel showcased a professional A1 service quality i.e. neat quiet room cleaned twice a day , bountiful breakfast ,steady WIFI ... That's it in a nutshell , Hopefully I will achieve a longer stay in Tureky visit 3 cities at least but first I'll stop by the Q Inn Hotel old city for sure ( just a matter of time ! lol ) Best.

Reviews.Title: “QInn Istanbul review”
Reviews.Author: Amy M M
Reviews.Content: Great location, fairly good rooms, clean comfortable bed, room a bit tatty as wall paper on wall falling off, but for price not too bad but not great. Breakfast totally awful - worst we had by a mile in Turkey. Small rooms. Service of front desk staff great.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place near Topkapi Palace”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: Whilst the room was a little on the small side, it was modern and very comfortable. The location is pretty good, just off the main drag through Sirkeci - quiet but easy walking distance to the main tourist attractions. The nearby tram is a useful way to navigate to other parts of the city so very easy to get around. Staff were polite and helpful and they will look after your bags during the day if you are leaving in the evening. The free breakfast wasn't so much to my taste but not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Q-Inn Old City”
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival in-country, I had a 2-night stay at the Q-Inn Old City, and last night, prior to return flight to the US also. This hotel is so excellently located, I can't imagine not staying there. The rooms are well maintained, have windows that open, outstanding bathroom, amenities are extensive, the beds are comfy, and the room size is typical of European standards...somewhat on the smaller side. Flat panel TV (minimal English speaking channels and in-room safe. Their morning breakfast buffet is less than desireable, but there are always street vendors to supplement your need. A cup (instant) of coffee, some cheese, sliced meat and piece of bread, along with cereal, yogurt, juice & hard boiled eggs is it. All in all, very modern and highly recommend staying here. Only bad comment is noise from construction across the street, and street noise (loud talking) outside the hotel. My next visit to Istanbul, this is my choice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vladimir S
Reviews.Content: Unformal, sweet and in the best location in Istanbul, quiet old city part where you can feel the spirit of Istanbul. Great staff especially front desk, Seda and other guys will make you fell like home. Sure we will visit you again. Ana and Vladimir, Macedonia

Reviews.Title: “Construction and noise”
Reviews.Author: stephenMilford
Reviews.Content: This review will stand apart from the others simply because of the construction that is occurring just outside the hotel area. The work continues through the night and if you are on the non-entrance side of the hotel is all that others say it is. We and a number of others in our group had rooms on the wrong side of the hotel. A crane, frontend loader, sledge hammers and load voices are accompanied by music throuhgout the entire night. The construction is just outside the entrance to the hotel We were disappointed by this and elected not come back to the hotel upon our return to Istanbul at the end of our trip. Strongly suggest that you inquire about the construction and insist upon a room on the non-entrance side of the hotel. Some members of our group did not experience any of the problems we had. I sincerely wish that I did not have to write this review but I felt obligated to do so as I depend upon the honest evaluations provided by reviewers. Had it not been for the noise I would give it a much higher rating-4 stars. I was assured that the construction was going to stop-it didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: earl21
Reviews.Content: I have been in Istanbul recently and i stayed at Q-Inn Hotel and it was a great experience thanks to my hotel choice. The rooms are clean and in a great condition. There were really comfortable beds, and staff was so friendly and helpful for having touristic informations. Great location near to touristic attractions, it is just in a walking distance to Hagia sophia and spice bazaar. Thank you Q-Inn Hotel for their attentions ;)

Reviews.Title: “One Word..Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Scotty K
Reviews.Content: I am not one to write reviews normally but I thought it wouldn't be right for me not to in this case. I visited Q-inn with my girlfriend and all I can say is that it was amazing. From the moment we checked in the staff were extremely helpful and attentive to our needs. The room we stayed in was very clean when we arrived. The breakfast was very delicious just as we expected after hearing so much about the wonderful Turkish cuisine. As for the location of the hotel, it was a very short distance from the "City Centre" where you can find amazing bars and nightlife, but also in the middle of the historic beauty of Istanbul. I would definitely recommend this city ANd this hotel to anyone looking for a great holiday while being pampered like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Joan C
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to Istanbul last month and stayed at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful and made us very welcome. The staff in the reception area spoke very good english and we did not have issues when we asked for directions. The triple bed accommodation was nice. The room we initially stayed was a bit small and not a lot of space but it was cosy. When we got back from the tour and back to the hotel we were given a much bigger room which was much appreciated. The breakfast consisted a variety of cheeses, bread, eggs, ham and sausages, tea and coffee. I liked our stay here in the hotel. The location was perfect and the staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AB_LD11
Reviews.Content: Q-Inn is located right in the heart of the old city, close to a tram stop and within walking distance of all major attractions. It is also in a side street, thereby cushioned from the noise. The rooms were neat, clean and attractive. Well worth a stay

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Adam ...”
Reviews.Author: Tjohonson
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent.. Perfect location .. Close to everything that you gonna needed .. Helpfully staff specially Adam thank you so much for your help and friendship

Reviews.Title: “nice holiday”
Reviews.Author: amira b
Reviews.Content: hi im amira from tunisia i want to say that i enyoyed my holliday in qinn hotel it is really a lovely hotel very comfortable and near to the important places to see :) the hotel is clean and receptionist cem is very kind helpful polite and very professionel i want to thank him for every thing :)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: snrygt19
Reviews.Content: Qinn is nice.clean and confortable otel in Istanbul...We just stay 3 night but we don't want go back to our city.They was like our family and feel at the home..Hotel staff is kind and helpfull.The hotel neer every where in old city.Just walking distince all around the touristic atraction.. Thanks for all staf and manager...

Reviews.Title: “Nice and freandly hotel”
Reviews.Author: erdlks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is realy confortable and nice hotel around the old city. Freandly and good service from the all staf. We ll back to again we hope

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Alaa_Deeb
Reviews.Content: nice and neat hotel small hotel polite staff and fine room service fine breakfast and diverse poor WiFi location is near to metro stop problems in airing

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel nice location”
Reviews.Author: frankyee
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay was included in a package tour from OnlineTurkeyTours. The hotel & the tour was less expensive than just the hotel stay at the Ottoman Imperial. So, you can understand why this is such a value package albeit not your fancy hotel. The room size was just about the same as Econolodge in the states & 1/2 of a typical US hotel. There was a desk, closet, & good air conditioning, but the bathroom was small, dimly lit, & very basic. It was comfy enough for sleeping but not for hanging around or having visitors. The common space is also small, with one sofa & two chairs. The hotel has been refurbished and things look new but small & tight. We stayed in the new section, which had very narrow halls & is accessed through a tiny path through the restaurant. The elevator is a strange two person-at-a-time thing with no door. Keep your hands to your side! The included breakfast was not geared to American tastes & the seating was very limited. Everything pretty much came out of a can or were dry goods, except for two warm dishes and cheeses. Beverages included unusually strong Turkish tea & cranberry juice. The front desk was very helpful & had to be called on several times to figure out how to work the safe in the room. No instructions, hidden buttons, & strange keying had some of our party giving up on the device. Language was not a problem. Although the neighborhood had been disparaged by our travel agent, we loved the old town. It feels very Istanbul & plenty colorful. It was within walking distance of all of the attractions we visited except Asiatic Istanbul & a night club show, both of which were parts of our tour. There were lots of small shops for sundries & snacks, & many lower cost restaurants. The streets are narrow & organically laid out, about the same as old towns in Italy. We felt totally safe & although there were many shuttered buildings, the area was vibrant and not blighted. My guess is that this hotel is heavily booked by tour companies because of its low cost, good location (near sights), & adequate everything else. When we checked availability, there were no rooms in the Sept 2011 time frame but our tour booked us in immediately. The tour company must reserve large blocks of time. If you get a chance to book the room yourself, it is a good choice if you don't plan to stay in your room much & are willing to go out for breakfast occasionally.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff and excellent central position.”
Reviews.Author: sweetpeapb1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night prior to going on a tour and although we checked out at 10am we were made to feel welcome using the restaurant and outdoor seating as well as lobby till we departed at 8pm. Stored our excess bags for free also for 15 days. Helpful people.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor room conditions”
Reviews.Author: jack.goodwin
Reviews.Content: We just completed a two night stay at the Q Inn in old town Istanbul. We loved the location and the Inn appeared to be very nice, The front desk was very helpful and we were encouraged. However, that's before we saw our rooms. The smell coming out of the bathroom was unbearable. It smelled of sewage. We requested another room, only to told there were none available. They told us it was a problem with the 4th floor. They obviously knew of the problem, as they tried to cover it with some type of perfume. This room should have been locked off and not rented. If that wasnâ€™t enough the room was freezing. They sent up a technician, however he only managed to get the heat turned on and the room quickly became too hot. The only solution was to open the window. The breakfast was not to our liking, however the dinner at the restaurant was very good and reasonable. The staff was very nice and tried to accommodate, however it was way too much to overcome!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Mary B
Reviews.Content: IWe recently had a few nights at the Q Inn in Istanbul prior to a tour. The location was excellent as we were close to everything that we wanted to see.The staff were all friendly and very helpful ( especially Gem who was on the night shift,)The breakfast was more than adequate.The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.I would love to visit Istanbul again some day and would have no hesitation in rebooking this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Juistice
Reviews.Content: This September I made my first visit to Turkey. My very first stop was in Q Inn hotel in Istanbul for 3 nights. It was a great start to my adventurous trip and discovery of Turkey. Attentive welcome from staff was very helpful and pleasant after long trip. I agree with many previous postings about the convenient location of the place. This is where you want to stay where you are planning to visit historic sites. Clean room and comfortable bed promoted good rest and rejuvenation for the next day tours. Mornings started with satisfying good breakfast. Friendly staff always accommodating and helpful. My special thank you to Yasin and Adem. I hope to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “It was really pleasant ... Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Nizar c
Reviews.Content: We spend two nights in Istanbul, our stay in Q Inn Hotel was really nice. First, The hotel location in Sultan Ahmet is really helpful to visit the old city and the historic sites like Topkapi palace, St Sophie, Blue mosque, Gulhane PARC ..... etc. Secondly, the alleyway's and the backstreet's in that part of Istanbul was lively at any moment ... specially a lot of restaurants which prepare different style of cooking (Turkish and others). The lobby and the restaurant had almost Louis XV style with modern tendency, ... About the room everything was correct, WC also was tidy clean after housekeeping. Finally, I can't finish my comment without say " tesekkur ederim" to Jam and Adam .. two guys who was working night shift and we sympathize.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Easy”
Reviews.Author: Alicia A
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in istanbul and stayed at the Q-inn. The room was very comfortable and extremely clean. The hotel is positioned closely to the tram line but regardless it is only a 5-10 minute walk to the palace, hagia sophia and blue mosque. We happily stumbled on the spice market which was also just a few minutes walk away. The staff were mostly nice, we did have one dodgy guy try and charge equivalent of 17euro for a small bag of washing when he delivered it to our room, we obviously refused to pay and felt a little disappointed that even in our hotel people can try and rip you off. Otherwise we felt well looked after!! The breakfast each day was not spectacular but more than sufficient and with such great food so close by there wasn't much of an incentive to fill up on hotel food anyway. I would recommend staying here if you want something clean, safe and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “QInn Hotel - Great Location; Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Liketogo72
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week trip to Turkey. While in Istanbul, we stayed at the QInn. It was clean, comfortable and in a great location. You can walk to many of the attractions. We stayed two different times during our two weeks-- the first time, the room and bathroom were fairly large. The second time both were smaller but still comfy. Air conditioners were perfect in both rooms! The staff was so nice, especially Adem Guzez and Cem. Breakfast was very good too. This is a nice middle of the road hotel. I think you will like it very much. We did.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: newwalla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Q-Inn Hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is nothing special. It is in a good location to the Spice Bazaar. After reading several reviews here, we expected a nice hotel at an affordable rate. When we first arrived, there was construction on the Hotel's street leading to the hotel. The rooms itself were okay meaning there was a bed and a bathroom. It looked nothing like the pictures they posted on their website. As for the breakfast buffet, don't expect anything really. As for the staff, they were nice but everytime we asked the front desk person for restaurant recommendations he kept telling us the same restaurant everytime. He kept telling us we need to book ahead to get into the restaurant. Overall, I don't think I would come back here.

Reviews.Title: “nothing fancy but good service”
Reviews.Author: sharon g
Reviews.Content: PROS: 1. really FRIENDLY and HELPFUL - somehow there was a mixup and my mother realized at the hotel that her luggage was still at the hotel! the hotel was really nice and wanted to send a taxi with the luggage. the whole ordeal was stressful but we got the luggage in time for take off! 2. GOOD LOCATION - it's a 5-10 min walk to shops, Grand Bazaar, and harbor 3. at breakfast you can ask them to make you a cappacino from their espresso machine CONS: 1. small rooms, a little dated 2. food is nothing fancy

Reviews.Title: “i will be back the next summer inchalah”
Reviews.Author: MED_kh
Reviews.Content: i've passed my summer holidays in qinn hotel and it's very nice service is good and the rooms are beautiful decoreted,the workers there are so freindly and especially my freind Cem the reception man.Qinn hotel is close to everything restaurent cafÃ© markets the tramway.....it's true that in istanbul there is many hotel ranked more than QINN but the most imporatant that you feel confortable

Reviews.Title: “A rocky start but in the end it was a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: neverenoughtravel73
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Istanbul with my 72 year old father after having spent two weeks in Croatia, I had dreamed of traveling to Istanbul for about 10 years and my dream was finally coming true. I booked the Q-Inn hotel Sultanahmet over the internet and confirmed with the hotel at least twice as well as our airport pick up since we were staying five days with them, they told me someone would be at the airport to pick us up with our family name on a sign. Well guess what, when we arrived there was no one! I called the hotel from the airport and was informed that they did not have a reservation for us and the hotel Q-Inn Sultanahmet was full. I was very frustrated and not pleased to hear this as I had taken the time to confirm our reservation more than once fearing this type of misfortune. In the end, the manager told us to take a taxi and he would cover the cost (which he did but it took some time and the taxi driver did not seem happy with the end result - but of course since they were conversing in Turkish we did not understand a thing.) They found us room in their Q-Inn hotel Old city which we were not pleased about at first since we did not think it was in as good a location. AS it turned out it was in a good location, a walk or tram ride away from most of the sites. This was the newest hotel so it was clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was having some leaking problems from the toilet as well as the shower which was concerning since the hotel was not even a year old when we stayed there. The staff was very friendly (however sometimes the english was extremely limited, the manager when you could get a hold of him (as he managed both hotels) did speak good English.) We felt that the price of the hotel was good value since it was comfortable and clean and we had free airport transfer to and from the airport. One word of caution we ate at the restaurant the night we got in and that was a mistake, my father got a mild case of food poisoning from undercooked hamburger. Find somewhere else for dinner, the breakfast was fine and had a pretty good selection. Would likely find another place to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: chuckd05
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my experience at the Q-Inn. It was an absolutely beautiful hotel. From the time I walked in everyone in the hotel treated me so courteously. The reception Ms. Zuhal YÄ±lmaz, was so polite. She helped me find my room, granted any eminity I asked for and did everything with a smile. She was such a great help. The room was amazing. It had an awesome view and an incredible bed. When I come back to Instanbul I will be sure to stay at the Q-Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vestie1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great!! The staff is very very helpful and will do everything they can to take care of anything you need. The people at the front desk all speak English and are very accomodating. I was especially assisted by #Sedo#, who helped me with my plane tickets and arranging transport back to the airport. The bell hops are also extremely helpful. This hotel is neat and clean, and has a really good breakfast buffet included (the only thing lacking is the coffee-like most hotels in Turkey, instant coffee will have to suffice). And they welcome you with a complinentary beverage, true Turkish hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: bulgariantourist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Qinn for two nights and even though it is across the street from a construction site the interior was great. It is an updated modern hotel near the Old City of Istanbul near lively nightlife, shopping, and cafe's. The bathroom was clean and modern and the beds were comfortable. Thanks so much for Mr. Roma, for his great meeting :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: PhilTeresa_11
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in your Hotel and we would like to say we enjoyed our stay very much.Your rooms are very clean and your beds are very comfortable.All of your staff were very helpful and accommodating.Seala, at the desk was as very helpful and had a very pleasing and cheery personality.She helped us out with our travel plans directions and everything we needed even when she was very busy with many other things she stayed calm and pleasant.Thanks again and we would highly recommend your Hotel for its perfect location,the staff,cleanliness and comfort. Maybe we will see you again some day. Sincerely Philip & Teresa Hines

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected class not expected from the outside.”
Reviews.Author: sjamomMichigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Qinn for two nights and even though it is across the street from a construction site the interior was great. It is an updated modern hotel near the Old City of Istanbul near lively nightlife, shopping, and cafe's. The bathroom was clean and modern and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Better Service!”
Reviews.Author: Julia_hope72
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Istanbul from California, and we found the hotel based on reviews. The hotel is exactly what we wanted, not too big or too small, comfortable and very well located. However, one thing really stood out and that's the hotel service. It's people are really nice and we want to specially thank Sener, who took very good care of us. I think he knew Istanbul better than any of the tour guides. Thanks again for everything and we can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to this hotel and its staff our trip to Istanbul has not turned to a complete fiasco!”
Reviews.Author: LumosMaxima
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was not planned, but, unfortunately, we ran into big troubles with another hotel close near by: as it was all creepy and had nothing to do with its online rating... So, we picked Q-inn Old City pretty randomly, just because the girl at the reception Seda seemed nice and we wanted to leave Historical Preferred Hotel Oldcity asap. At the end, it was a terrific place to stay. For the same price (even lower, as Seda gave us special discounted rates at 65 euro per person per night) we got wonderful, spacious, quite, clean rooms with new furniture, solid beds and normal bathroom with a DOOR and NO toilet chair in the shower cabin (opposite to what we were offered at Historical Preferred), nice breakfast, top location, extremely helpful and understanding staff, cheap airport transfer. I recommend this hotel to anyone who comes to Istanbul both on business and leisure. And, Seda, thanks again for all your help and moral support!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent jop done”
Reviews.Author: Mjabla
Reviews.Content: Good and fantastic hotel to stay. Lacated very close to all tourist attractions. Staffs are very helpful. Well done. Cheers. Abdul was very helpful to giving direction and recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: erdlks
Reviews.Content: Thanks for all staf. Specility mr.sener. Hotel is just walking distince for all turistic atraction. Hotel restaurant has very dilacus turkish food. Thanks again for all staff.

Reviews.Title: “don't put 3 stars on ranking it is 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: vmvictor934
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my gril fiend , found the hotel discounted on the internet and the price was truly advantageous for such a quality. The room was equipped with everything, very clean, the included breakfast delicious and the location ideal, it is like 5 min walk from Haghia Sofiatopkapi palace blue mosque and undergraoun cistern . I was afraid that staying in the touristic area might be too loud but the street where the hotel is was very quiet. The staff acted very friendly and helpfull a spacially A.Selam ,seda they recommended us a restaurant on a roof with a REALLY spectacular view of Istanbul in Beyoglu near the Galata Tower and it would have been impossible for us to find it otherwise because it was hidden in the back streets. They offered us many times cay, the turkish thea, and they answered my questions with great patience. I highly recemond this hotel to stay when ever you goto istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaneRaste
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this location and love the proximity to the old Istanbul. The hotel is very comfortable and clean. Staff is extremely helpful, Selam particularly was great helping me finding nearby restaurant and historic places. Highly recommend this location. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “it is good hotel to see historical place”
Reviews.Author: cpinar63
Reviews.Content: it is good hotel to see historical part in istanbul and very close those place (snt sophia, blue mosque and topkapi palace ) the room are good but breakfast was poor bad ok staff a spacally abdul was very help full about giving information and making plan where to go and see it is good hotel and price was good alsoo

Reviews.Title: “Tourist Grade - OK but not good enough”
Reviews.Author: Leen2n2011
Reviews.Content: I was arranged to live in the Old City location - the hotel is ok but not as nice as pictured - staff is friendly and helpful, the WIFI works great, and it's convently located close to the tram stop and the Grand Bazaar - but the wall is paper thin, I can hear EVERYTHING - which is not good at all - also there was ongoing construction noises which is quite annoying - no coffee maker, no ice bucket - hot water is not so hot early in the morning or late at night - the singe room (double size bed) is just big enough to have some loor space for my one suitcase - I was placed in a double room by mistake temporarily and the double room is the same size as the single room, with an additon of a twin size bed - so there is practically NO space at all for even 1 suitcase - let along 2 or 3 - the breakfast buffet has many items but nothing I really wanted to eat - so I only just had coffee and OJ - overall, it's a tourist grade hotel - inexpensive and adequate - but looking back I would have been willing to pay more to stay in a nicer hotel -

Reviews.Title: “Best (ever) hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Ismahaty
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my 2 girlfriends and we stayed in Bursa for 2 nights and Cappadocia for 2 nights before coming to Istanbul and stayed at the Qinn Hotel (Sirkeci) for 3 nights. Of all the 3 hotels we have been to, Qinn Old City is the best among all, not only is the hotel located at a strategic area, (near to the Tram Station, a 10minutes walk from the Spice Bazaar), it is also equipped with courteous and friendly hotel personnel. Throughout our stay there, they were very kind to us and even though some speak limited English, they will go all the way to assist our needs, I would like to commend 3 exemplary staff: Seda, Vedat and Ibrahim. You guys made our stay memorable and pleasant. Thank you very much. Will definitely make a comeback to Qinn Old City(Sirkeci).

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel.........”
Reviews.Author: ahmedov
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Q inn in July 2010, we had done booking through an agent and were not expecting much from the hotel but to our surprise, it turned out to be excellent service and very caring management - We had a 3 year old child with us in our group and the staff did everything possible to make us comfortable. We stayed there once when we landed in Istanbul and decided to stay again when we came back to Istanbul from the 5 days tour of turkey before we departed. I have already recommended this hotel to many people. Also, their location is ideal for tourists and everything is close by, especially the old city and very close to tram station as well. It is not a 5 star hotel so one should not go with that expectation but it is great value for money in the boutique hotel category and i would rank it high up in its class. It is very safe and the most important thing is a friend in a foreign country which you will surely find in their staff and especially their manager Mr. Sener who gave us his personal attention in every small matter. I strongly recommend for any tourist

Reviews.Title: “Exclent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alsiddiqi
Reviews.Content: Dear manger I stay in your hotel 5 day and it was Wanderful I would like to thanks all staff for the good serves thay are very helpfull and allways smile Speshily ms secb and vecbt, ibrahim Next time when i plan to come istanbul i wel stay your hotel My best regards Adel alsiddiqi

Reviews.Title: “Friendly owner and staff, nice rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: TLTraveller
Reviews.Content: Likes: Renovated rooms In-room safe Wifi Nice hotel restaurant Good location to the sights Great owner 20Euros from the airport via a travel agency Dislikes: Let me think about it some more.... Overall: Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was very good and management was customer oriented.”
Reviews.Author: parthdave
Reviews.Content: Our stay was quite good & memorable. This hotel is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent basic hotel. Clean. Good location. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ballencrieff
Reviews.Content: Ended up at this hotel for a few days because every other hotel was booked completely. Strange thing is that I phoned up asking if they had room but they told me they were completely full and actually overbooked. But minutes later I checked on the internet (booking-com) and it said they had rooms. So I booked and when I arrived everything was fine. Very strange... The hotel is relatively new. This is not a luxury hotel. But it is very clean, modern and has everything you would expect from a quality hotel except they don't have irons and ironing boards. They will send your laundry out to get done, and that service is pretty quick. A few hours usually. I was on fifth floor. The view is terrible. A building site basically. But you don't stay here for the view. You should stay here because the location is excellent! You are very close to the Sirkeci and Gulhane tram stations.Also very close to Eminonu ferry ports and the best thing in Istanbul, the Topkapi Palace, is very close too. Shower and WC is small, but adequate. Double Rooms are a good size. Lots of wardrobe space. Room has a safe. Wifi on 5th floor was a bit poor.Wifi on 4th floor was much better and faster. Restaurant is simple but very good. Staff there are very very friendly. And the restaurant has good wifi too. Menu is limited but what they do offer is very good quality and reasonable prices. I would recommend eating in the restaurant here rather than go out to the local cafes and restaurants. Breakfast is also simple but good. Only one lift is available and it is not big, but it always seems available when you need it. Aircon was broken in my room. Not a problem as the weather was neither hot nor cold so I didnt need the aircon. Overall this is a great hotel. But keep in mind that getting to it will be difficult. It is in a pedestrianised area, so taxis cannot get you there. Best thing to do is ask them to take you to the Sirkeci or Gulhane tram stations and then walk from there. Make sure you have a map printed out because for some reason asking the local people where the hotel is will be met with blank looks.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: ellesdites
Reviews.Content: Great location very close to Sirkeci Train station. New Hotel, need to add some key items to hotel room -Do Not Disturb sign, instruction how to use safe, how to use the phone,and mini bar prices. Limited English spoken, ask for room in the front, breakfast staff still have to get clued in - loud tv playing rock videos, fresh glasses need to be replaced when there are none, powdered coffee free but have to pay for fresh coffee in breakfast buffet????

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, convenient and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: MaryS615
Reviews.Content: Great location for seeing the sights. It is on a quiet side street but you walk 20m to all the restaurants, shops and tram. The hotel has a lovely breakfast and nice rooms. The staff was always very helpful with everything from restaurant suggestions to tour bookings. Ali was so accomodating, friendly and helpful. Thank you for making my stay in Istanbul wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for touring in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hernandez919
Reviews.Content: The lost point on service has nothing to do with a bad experience... It's just we had trouble communicating in English. The staff members we met were helpful and friendly. The rooms were cozy... Not too small, but just right for a couple with a couple of bags. The location is perfect for walking down to the bosphorous or up the hill to the historic sites or exploring via the tram. The neighborhood is alive in the evening and rely what you want if you don't want to Stryker too far from the home after a long day of tours!

HotelInfo.Name: Q-Inn Hotel, Old City (Sirkeci)
HotelInfo.Address: Hocapasa Mah. Dervisler Sok. No.9 | Sirkeci, Istanbul 34110, Turkey
